abstract: Summary A critical examination of the species Turrisitala parramattensis (Cox), an euconulid land snail found in the Sydney region of N.S.W., revealed that this species is identical with the holarctic species Euconulus (E.) fulvus (Muller). This discovery represents the first record of E. fulvus from New South Wales. The only previous record of E. fulvus from Australia was from the Cann River district, Victoria (Gabriel, 1928). A description and a figure of E. fulvus based on the New South Wales material are given.
